page.title: 16PATCHAM COURT FARM
page.content: There has been a farm here since the original Domesday Book was written.At present the farm covers 350 acres. Nowadays the farm is mainly a dairy farm although some crops are grown.However the prices farmers get for milk products have been falling during the last few years because of the Common Agricultural Policy agreed by the Common Market countries. This means that the number of cows kept for milking have been falling over the past few years. At present 390 cows are kept of which 85 cows are actually being milked. The milk used to be collected by a lorry.Nowadays it is stored in a large tank which can hold up to 45 litres. The change was made for reasons of hygiene.The cows are milked twice a day.
